description: Australian e-bike laws by state and territory with official government sources

powerAssistedPedalCycle.description: Power-assisted pedal cycle: max 200W, cannot be propelled only by motor, must be primarily propelled by rider

electricallyPowerAssistedCycle.description: Electrically power-assisted cycle: max 500W, throttle allowed up to 6km/h without pedaling, power progressively reduced beyond 6km/h, cuts off at 25km/h

highPowerBikes.description: Electrically power-assisted cycles up to 500W are permitted but must meet specific requirements (progressive power reduction, cut-off at 25km/h)

throttleRestrictions.description: Throttle allowed up to 6km/h for electrically power-assisted cycles (up to 500W), or 200W maximum for power-assisted pedal cycles
throttleRestrictions.enforcement: Strict enforcement of speed and power limits

electricallyPowerAssistedCycle.description: Electrically Power-Assisted Cycle: max 250W, throttle allowed up to 6km/h (walk mode), motor cuts out at 25km/h

powerAssistedBicycle.description: Power-assisted bicycle: max 200W, can be propelled by throttle

throttleRestrictions.description: Throttle allowed up to 6km/h for 250W e-bikes (walk mode), or full throttle for 200W bikes

pedelec.description: Pedal-assist only, motor cuts out at 25km/h

throttleBike.description: Can be propelled by throttle, max 200W

throttleRestriction.description: ANY e-bike with throttle that can propel without pedaling is classified as a motorbike
throttleRestriction.enforcement: Strict - all throttle bikes require motorcycle license

throttleRestrictions.description: All throttle bikes are classified as motorbikes requiring license and registration
